reviews.sentence: Great NYE trip. Hotel was clean and comfortable. A little noisy but that is to be expected when on the main downtown strip. Parking would be tough but there is a garage nearby that hotel valet takes cars to. Location was AWESOME. If you are looking to go out for dinner and cocktails there are some great places in under a 5 minute walk.

Easy walking to everything. We only stayed for one night but would definitely stay again. We parked the car when we got there and walked everywhere. There are some really great restaurants and bars and everything was just a short walk from our room. The hotel bar was also really lively and fun. The room was great clean and the hotel staff were wonderful. There are some loud bars in the area but the hotel offers white noise machines and ear plugs if that is a problem for you. Walters is a nice restaurant right across the street and was amazing.
Noise. The only negative is the noise from the bars across the street. I probably will not return for that reason alone. Nice hotel otherwise.

walking distance to the best of portlandnoise is a big problem the hotel downplays how bad it is. the nightclub across the street is so loud the windows vibrate. police called multiple times to clubnight time lady desk clerk is very rude. she was actually arguing with guest at the counter. when asked about local steakhouses she only recommended the floating restauranta total tourist trap. did not even know that 1 block behind there is a fantastic local steakhouse. very glad we like walking in cities we visit. we go to Portland 3 times a year. this person treated us as first timers to her city.
Noisy due to local bars etc.

All around fantastic experience. We stayed the night before and the night of my wedding. We used the rooms to get ready and they were perfect. The staff was fantastic and super friendly. The free breakfast was an ACTUAL BREAKFAST not just bagels and donuts. And we just had a wonderful time. We were very aware that we booked a hotel directly across the street from 3 popular bars clubs on a friday and saturday night so we were not surprised or bothered by the noise level at 1 am. It quieted down around 130.
This is our second time staying here and I would definitely stay again. There is a bit of noise coming from the bars across the street it is not for the light sleeper.

Central hotel within walking distance of waterfron. A quick trip to Portland from Yarmouth taking Bay Ferry was a great experience. Recommend taking a taxi from ferry terminal to hotel as the wonderful city has cobble roads and brick sidewalks. conditions that would not be suitcase wheel friendly. The hotel has a very friendly front desk staff member who quickly got me checked in and on my way to my room and my afternoon tour. This happened super fast. The hotel is near many tour outlets shops and restaurants. It can not go unmentioned that there are NUMEROUS gelato places in the neighbourhood which was perfect for the humid days I experienced. Do ask about the potato doughnut place very interesting experience. If you like to walk this is the city for you. Location is ideal if you do not have a vehicle. The hotel is near many tour outlets shops and restaurants. The waterfront is very short walk where you can take in tours water activities or dine. More details about what is around Portland and offering of day tours available.
Wonderful. No dairyfre or glutenfre options for breakfast.

Pleasant hotel near the wonderful Old Port of Portland Maine. Spacious living sleeping room and spacious bathroom bathroom with big towels not changed daily as advertised ie green. View of harbor from 6th floor. Quiet but efficient heating cooling unit. TV with excellent picture quality and lots of channels available. All four pillows were very firm would have liked a soft one or two for choice. Breakfast included was no better than at many less expensive hotels. Check in parking space limited and congested but there is no place else.

Nice hotel in the middle of Old Port. Great location close to all restaurants and shops. Valet parking made this an easy stay. Very nice staff. The bed spread and one of the pillow cases was soiled so we called housekeeping off hours and a staff person delivered a new bed cover and two new clean pillows. Location and nice rooms.

Great in town hotel with convenient parking. We were very fortunate to be upgraded to a top floor suite which was lovely and so kind. While i was in no way disappointed with the room it was a bit sterile. The lobby and bar give an opulent vibe that i expected to carry into the rooms. Reality felt very corporate. Again not disappointed just not what I would choose had I known. Overall the hotel was quite nice. The free breakfast was a larger spread than expected and pleasing. Only two true disappointments no bathtub and the pool is tiny. You could not do laps in that pool and four or more people would be a serious crowd. I think the space would be better used as a spa hot tub. You can not beat the location right in the heart of the Old Port. The garage is convenient but a little confusing. The is no entrance to the Hotel. Opt to be dropped or pay the very small fee for valet. Lobby Bar Breakfast Location. Heart of the Old Port. Hundreds of restaurants and bars. All that Portland has to offer is mere steps away. Replace the ridiculously small pool with a nice jacuzi spa.

Great place to stay in Portland. My husband I were very pleased with our stay at the Hyat Place in Portland. The location was perfect and the breakfast which is included was fantastic. The only downfall was that our room was on the road side and the club across the street was bumping until 1 am that Saturday night. we will head back to the Hyat Place when we head back to Portland. Thanks.

central. best location in portland a new clean and confortable hotel in city old town. difficult to think something better. simple but good breakfast with local products. very good value for money steps from resturants bar shops and in the heart of historical district historical downtown breakfast in peak time looks little overcrowded.

Perfect in Portland. Incredible location with great views of the harbor. The bars restaurants shops with in a 3 block radius are amazing. Highly recommend Street Company for seafood lovers which is 2 blocks away. Great staff. Nice hot cold breakfast in the lobby. Was able to find a spot on the street after 6 and park for free. Only complaint was the water pressure in the shower was extremely low.
Great location. Very clean room very approachable staff good breakfast and situated at the center of Portland.

Best Breakfast Ever FREE. The hotel was comfy clean and very conveniently located in Old Port. Close to everything we wanted to do. The best part was the amazing free breakfast in the morning. Wonderful quality not commonly found in complimentary breakfasts.
6th floor room. Smaller than our usually room that we get and things looks a bit more run down than usual not housekeeping related. higher view was nice. service and breakfast were great.

Excellent location staff is amazing. This is one of my favorite hotels to stay at during business trips. The location is fantastic and the staff always go above and beyond. The views from the balcony are beautiful and the near by restaurants are all in walking distance and fantastic.

Still the best place to stay in Old Port for a wonderful view. This is our second time staying here and it did not disappoint. The King Peaks Island View Balcony room is well worth the money. We had it both stays and it offers an amazing and private. relaxing view is the sunrise and Casco Bay. The service was wonderful and friendly just as we received in the past. Clean hotel and rooms and a good breakfast included. The movies that they run at night in the bar is a fun feature.
